title._content: This little girl like many others in this state is so small she has to stand on a box to reach her machine ...  Location: Loudon, Tennessee (LOC)

description._content: Hine, Lewis Wickes,, 1874-1940,, photographer. This little girl like many others in this state is so small she has to stand on a box to reach her machine. She is regularly employed as a knitter in London [i.e., Loudon?] Hosiery Mills. Said she did not know how long she had worked there. (See other photos and report.) Location: Loudon, Tennessee. 1910 December. 1 photographic print. Notes: Title from NCLC caption card. Attribution to Hine based on provenance. In album: Mills. Hine no. 1883. There is both a Loudon and a London, Tennessee. UMBC records similar photos as "Loudon," however. Subjects: Girls. Textile mill workers. Mills. Hosiery industry. Textile machinery. United States--Tennessee--Loudon. Format: Photographic prints. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Part Of: Photographs from the records of the National Child Labor Committee (U.S.) 2004667950 General information about the Lewis Hine child labor photos is available at hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.nclc Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/nclc.02003 Call Number: LOT 7479, v. 3, no. 1883
